Maltcms 1.1 Released on February 10th, 2012
The Modular Application Toolkit for Chromatography Mass Spectrometry project is a framework mainly for programmers and power-users for data preprocessing tasks, such as filtering, baseline correction, peak finding, alignment, and visualization of high-throughput data.
Maltcms 1.1.0 has seen a large number of changes:
Changed configuration system from property files to Spring XML Bean definition format for improved and easier and more flexible exchange/configuration of components.
Integration of the MPAXS parallelization framework for much simpler parallelization with automatic task synchronization.
Improvements on running time and space usage of the alignment algorithms.
New Wavelet-based peak finding algorithm for GCxGC-MS data.
Improved TIC-based peak finding algorithm for GC-MS data (and general one-dimensional trajectory data).
Refactorings and cleanup in various areas to reduce interdependencies of modules.
Integration of the Groovy scripting language.
Known Issues:
Xml io providers (except for mzML) may be rather slow on access, this will be fixed in one of the next releases.
To get started, please visit the Maltcms 1.1 Maven site.
